32#ifndef _LINUX_ERR_H_
33#define _LINUX_ERR_H_
34
35/* XXX Linux uses long and int inconsistently here. Hope this works out. */
36
37#include <sys/types.h>
38#include <sys/errno.h>
39#include <sys/systm.h>
40
41#define MAX_ERRNO 4095
42
43static inline bool
44IS_ERR_VALUE(uintptr_t n)
45{
46 return (n >= (uintptr_t)-MAX_ERRNO);
47}
48
49static inline void *
50ERR_PTR(long error)
51{
52 KASSERT(error < 0);
53 return (void *)(intptr_t)error;
54}
55
56static inline long
57PTR_ERR(const void *ptr)
58{
59 KASSERT(ptr == (void *)(intptr_t)(long)(intptr_t)ptr); /* XXX Hurk! */
60 return (long)(intptr_t)ptr;
61}
62
63static inline bool
64IS_ERR(const void *ptr)
65{
66 return IS_ERR_VALUE((uintptr_t)ptr);
67}
68
69static inline bool
70IS_ERR_OR_NULL(const void *ptr)
71{
72 return ((ptr == NULL) || IS_ERR(ptr));
73}
74
75static inline void *
76ERR_CAST(void *ptr) /* XXX Linux declares with const. */
77{
78 return ptr;
79}
80
81static inline long
82PTR_ERR_OR_ZERO(const void *ptr)
83{
84 return (IS_ERR(ptr)? PTR_ERR(ptr) : 0);
85}
86
87#define PTR_RET PTR_ERR_OR_ZERO
88
89#endif /* _LINUX_ERR_H_ */
90
